<<<api>>>: RandomAccessFile.write
<<<code>>>: {
    File input = new File(filePath);
    long fileLength = input.length();
    byte[] data;
    byte[] buff = new byte[data.length];
    long JUMP_LENGTH = 10 * 1024;
    RandomAccessFile raf = new RandomAccessFile(input, "rw");
    long step = JUMP_LENGTH + data.length;
    for (long i = 0; i < fileLength; i += step) {
        // read to buffer
        raf.seek(i);
        raf.read(buff);
        raf.seek(i); // make sure it moves to the correct place after reading
        raf.write(data);
    }
    raf.close();
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using the RandomAccessFile API to read and write data to a file. We first calculate the file length and define the jump length, which is the amount of bytes we want to move the cursor by in each iteration. We then create a RandomAccessFile object using the file path and "rw" mode. In each iteration, we use the seek() method to move the cursor to the current position, read the data into a buffer, and then move the cursor back to the same position using seek(). Finally, we write the data to the file using the write() method. This process is repeated until we have processed the entire file.
